subject: Management
title: Strategy Is Choosing
description: A 60-second lesson on Strategy Is Choosing.

hook.text: Southwest Airlines chose: no assigned seats, no meals, no hub routes. Every competitor tried to do everything.

buildup.text: Most companies confuse strategy with goals. We want to grow 20% is a goal, not a strategy.

discovery.text: Michael Porter: strategy is deliberately choosing what not to do. It's a set of trade-offs.

twist.text: Trying to serve everyone means serving no one well. Strategy requires saying no to good opportunities.

climax.text: Ask: what are we deliberately not doing? If you can't answer, you don't have a strategy.

punchline.text: Strategy isn't about doing more. It's about choosing less.

quiz.question: According to Michael Porter, what is strategy?
options: Deliberately choosing what not to do through a set of trade-offs
Setting ambitious growth targets for the organization
Doing everything competitors do but doing it better
